text:
DRAFT
DRAFT
Dear Professor Sapon:
My invitation by telephone was a rather last-
minute thing and I gather you could not manage the
trip. I am sorry that we could not have made plans
well in advance.
Mr. Gregory would still like to talk with you
about the problem of method in presenting the material
in each 15-minute program. If you could come down
to New York I would like to come up from Washington
at the same time. Would June 24th be a possibility?
The National Association of Educational Broadcasters
will pay travel according to U.S.government regulations,
also $16.00 per diem and a consultant's fee of
$50.00 a day.
Dean Gregory's address is International House
(Apt. 2-H) 500 Riverside Dr., New York 27, New York
and his telephone number is Monument 6-7600. My
telephone here is WOrth 36378 or (for messages)
WOrth 33189.
Yours sincerely.
Robert C. Goodell
Radio English-Teaching Branch
Voice of America
Professor Stanley Sapon
University of Rochester
Rochester,
New York
